Governance.QuestionText: Leverage Azure Policy strategically, define controls for your environment, using Policy Initiatives to group related policies.

RawSource.text: Leverage Azure Policy strategically, define controls for your environment, using Policy Initiatives to group related policies.

Governance.QuestionText: Map regulatory and compliance requirements to Azure Policy definitions and Azure role assignments.

RawSource.text: Map regulatory and compliance requirements to Azure Policy definitions and Azure role assignments.

Governance.QuestionText: Establish Azure Policy definitions at the intermediate root management group so that they can be assigned at inherited scopes.

RawSource.text: Establish Azure Policy definitions at the intermediate root management group so that they can be assigned at inherited scopes.

Governance.QuestionText: Manage policy assignments at the highest appropriate level with exclusions at bottom levels, if required.

RawSource.text: Manage policy assignments at the highest appropriate level with exclusions at bottom levels, if required.

Governance.QuestionText: Use Azure Policy to control which services users can provision at the subscription/management group level.

RawSource.text: Use Azure Policy to control which services users can provision at the subscription/management group level.

Governance.QuestionText: Use built-in policies where possible to minimize operational overhead.

RawSource.text: Use built-in policies where possible to minimize operational overhead.

Governance.QuestionText: Assign the built-in Resource Policy Contributor role at a particular scope to enable application-level governance.

RawSource.text: Assign the built-in Resource Policy Contributor role at a particular scope to enable application-level governance.
RawSource.description: Assigning the Resource Policy Contributor role to specific scopes allows you to delegate policy management to relevant teams. For instance, a central IT team may oversee management group-level policies, while application teams handle policies for their subscriptions, enabling distributed governance with adherence to organizational standards.

Governance.QuestionText: Limit the number of Azure Policy assignments made at the root management group scope to avoid managing through exclusions at inherited scopes.

RawSource.text: Limit the number of Azure Policy assignments made at the root management group scope to avoid managing through exclusions at inherited scopes.

Governance.QuestionText: If any data sovereignty requirements exist, Azure Policies should be deployed to enforce them.

RawSource.text: If any data sovereignty requirements exist, Azure Policies should be deployed to enforce them.

Governance.QuestionText: For Sovereign Landing Zone, deploy sovereignty policy baseline and assign at correct management group level.

RawSource.text: For Sovereign Landing Zone, deploy sovereignty policy baseline and assign at correct management group level.

Governance.QuestionText: For Sovereign Landing Zone, document Sovereign Control objectives to policy mapping.

RawSource.text: For Sovereign Landing Zone, document Sovereign Control objectives to policy mapping.

Governance.QuestionText: For Sovereign Landing Zone, ensure process is in place for management of 'Sovereign Control objectives to policy mapping'.

RawSource.text: For Sovereign Landing Zone, ensure process is in place for management of 'Sovereign Control objectives to policy mapping'.
